review: Dec 24: family ready for a movie night: FireTV lets me down big time. Telling family about network issues (emberrassing). Dec 31: same thing all over again. Finally I plug back in my old Roku (just for giggles). Roku works perfectly, family movie night is saved. FireTV is toast. Must be an inferior desing (FireTv that is). Not sure what it is, but you can't rely on it in real life situations. Stick to your Roku...Sorry to write this review, big time Amazon fan, but this is just unacceptable.

review: Love the Amazon Fire TV - got a great deal with a discount for purchasing an HDTV. The reason I chose this over Roku is that it has a separate optical audio output.The only negative is that the optical output produces either straight stereo, or Dolby Digital Plus - my older receiver can't understand the Dolby Digital Plus and hence I have to use straight stereo. I'm told this should be backward compatible, however this might not be an issue at all with the Fire TV. Maybe it's time to upgrade my receiver.
